title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: sleep-debt-tracker is a web-based project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users track and manage their sleep debt. This repository provides a functional and visually appealing tool for individuals to monitor their sleep patterns and identify areas for improvement, focusing on utilizing TypeScript for a structured and maintainable codebase.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a web application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript focused on providing a platform for streamlined voting processes. This project utilizes modern web development techniques to create a user-friendly and efficient solution for various voting scenarios, encompassing aspects of project management and decision-making within a group or organization.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface, built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, for monitoring and controlling robotic fleets. This project allows users to visualize robot status, telemetry data, and execute commands, serving as a comprehensive dashboard solution for managing and interacting with multiple robots simultaneously.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router) and TypeScript, leveraging MUI for styling and React Query for efficient data fetching and management. This repository showcases a practical application of modern web development technologies and best practices, focusing on building a dynamic and performant user interface. It provides a valuable learning resource for developers interested in combining these tools for project development.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern web application built with Next.js, leveraging TypeScript for type safety, CSS for styling, and JavaScript for dynamic functionality. This repository serves as a practical example of a dashboard implementation, exploring common UI patterns and data management techniques within the Next.js ecosystem.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built using TypeScript and JavaScript. This repository serves as a central hub for development, tracking progress, and managing issues related to the Raven-v2 project. It leverages modern web technologies for a streamlined and efficient development workflow.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project showcasing interactive map visualizations built using HTML for the front-end and Python for data processing or backend logic (if applicable). This repository serves as a demonstration of map-related projects and exploration of geographical data visualization techniques, focusing on implementing interactive features and leveraging spatial data.

title: jovian
description: The jovian repository contains a CRUD application built with Python and Flask, utilizing PostgreSQL for data management. This project showcases the creation of a full-stack web application and covers key topics such as database interactions, backend development, and front-end presentation with HTML, CSS, and shell scripting for deployment or automation.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS with shell scripting for utility functions, this project provides a user-friendly interface for navigating, filtering, and understanding ROS logs to aid in debugging and performance analysis within robotics projects.

title: resume
description: This repository contains my resume, crafted primarily using LaTeX for professional formatting and potentially supplemented by HTML for online presentation. It serves as a personal project showcasing my skills and experience, designed for both print and digital viewing. The project focuses on creating a clear and concise representation of my professional background.

This project, built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, explores concepts related to the project topic. It leverages TypeScript for enhanced code maintainability, JavaScript for dynamic functionality, and CSS/HTML for structuring and styling the user interface, providing a hands-on learning experience.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-Event-Calendar is a project showcasing a dynamic and interactive event calendar built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This repository demonstrates how to create a user-friendly interface for displaying and managing events, focusing on front-end technologies and project-based learning.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase for tracking and managing IoT assets. This project utilizes a modern tech stack to provide a user-friendly interface for monitoring the location and status of connected devices, offering a practical solution for asset management in various IoT applications.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, is a collection of projects focused on applying data analysis and programming techniques to the realm of finance. It explores various financial concepts and topics through practical examples and code, offering insights into areas like portfolio management, risk analysis, and financial modeling.

title: genietalks

It explores building applications with modern web technologies while focusing on integrating the Gemini API for [briefly mention the API's role, e.g., conversational AI or image generation].

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-Idea-Board is a dynamic project management tool built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to help users brainstorm, organize, and prioritize their ideas. Leveraging modern web technologies, this application provides a visual board for capturing thoughts, categorizing them, and tracking their progress, making it ideal for personal projects, team collaborations, or general ideation.

title: fruit-seller
description: fruit-seller is an e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and JavaScript, leveraging MUI for the user interface and React Query for efficient data fetching. This repository showcases a typed, modern web application architecture and serves as a practical example for developers looking to implement similar features and technologies in their own projects.
